page.title: 08SAINT BARBARAS CHURCH ASHTON
page.content: The state of church life at{Saint {Barbaras, Ashton under Hill}in 1985 is rather a sad one. Gone are the days of large congregations led by a full and enthusiastic choir and of one priest per parish. Instead the congregations are small, mainly middle aged to elderly, led in service by half a dozen devoted choir members and served by a priest who is shared with two other parishes amounting to four other churches. This small church community has the added burden of maintaining an ancient building which needs thousands of pounds spent on it, at a time of high unemployment and world recession. A bright spot at{St. Barbaras}is it's lively Sunday School, which it is hoped, will ensure the survival of the church in the next decade.
